result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: with Exhibit #1 attached
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

3:05 PM (64-06) Defendant Anthony P Hansen appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Robert Barth in court for Anthony P Hansen.  Attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld in court for State of Wisconsin. 
22CF446 & 22CF468 - Both cases heard together. No objection by the attorney's.
Motion for Testing. DA Wiedenfeld made a record that the defendant is not objecting to testing. The State will prepare the Order under a 5-day rule.

State called to the stand as a witness, Detective Jacob Hintz.
Jacob Hintz duly sworn and testified on direct examination by DA Wiedenfeld.
Witness has identified the defendant on video in court. Exhibit #1 in both cases (22CF446 & 22CF468) marked, identified and discussed.
3:20PM - Argument by DA Wiedenfeld.
3:20PM - Argument by Attorney Barth.
Victim not in court.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him over to stand trial on the charges. 
Attorney Barth acknowledged receipt of the Information in both cases, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.

Adj. 3:24PM
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Anthony P Hansen appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Chris Kuehn for Michael Robert Barth in court for Anthony P Hansen.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien Ten Haken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim also present in court. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Preliminary hearing set. Minutes filed.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Letter to Court regarding 8/30 court date
Attorney Barth

Adjustment Number: 22A 263201,
Payable Number: 267866,
Receipt Number: 22R 016530,
Amount: $20.00

BOND TO COVER 22GF894 & 22CF446

ABSOLUTELY NO ACCESS TO SOCIAL MEDIA AT ALL. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.B.C. OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Notice of Bail Bond Forfeiture and Hearing. Bond set 7-25-22

Defendant Anthony P Hansen in court, in custody by video.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mike Barth in court. Total cash bond set. Prior bond forfeited. Minutes filed.
Further proceedings scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
